question: -- to try and take Mr. And Mrs. America's guns?

answer: It's a 223 M-4.

question: Are you seeing a pattern?

answer: Why -- Alex. I don't --

question: Why did our government ship guns to Mexico?

question: To blame the Second Amendment?

question: A false flag?
answer: Alex, I get accused --

question: To blame the Second Amendment?

question: Why did they blow up buildings down the street here in New York?

answer: Yes.

question: -- therefore have an AR-15 if they want one?

question: But who do you believe was behind it?

question: Alex, who do you believe -- Alex, who do you believe was behind it, the American government?

question: Alex. Alex. Do you mean that President Bush and his administration were behind 9/11?
answer: I mean that even mainstream news reported that the hijackers were ordered to be allowed into the United States.

question: But is that what you believe?
answer: The government -- Hitler fired bombs and turned rash tag, Piers, to bring in martial law in Germany, April 27th, 1933.

question: How many guns do you own?
answer: I probably own more than 50 firearms.

question: What did you feel?

question: Really?
answer: When our during the aftermath of ObamaCare when there were -- the president was being held in effigy and these kinds of threatening comments of people like the man you just had on were blocking members of Congress from being able to go and vote, you may recall of that, --

answer: Well, as I said, I think that the lack of discourse -- so that that is really what's offensive in our country where we should be able to debate our problems without impugning the integrity of the people who have positions.

question: You're aware of that?

question: If you were at the meeting with the Vice President Biden, with the NRA and Wal-Mart and others, what would you be saying?
answer: That the discussion has not been going anywhere that we can tell in a productive way.

question: Right, so your solution if you were there in that meeting would be to arm every school, every church, every hospital, everywhere that members of the public can be?
answer: RATT: You certainly would want to encourage people who are qualified to carry a concealed firearm to be able to do so in a school zone.

question: So why on earth would the fact that it's a gun free zone make any difference to them?
answer: They're looking for -- it would seem in their sick minds to see if they can out-do the Virginia Tech slaughter, or some other thing that might be in their perverted minds.

question: So why should we give them a neon sign that says well, see if you can do better than the last guy over here?
answer: But you know there were armed security people at Virginia Tech.

question: My point to you, Mr. Pratt, is that even where you have a mass of well trained people and a mass of firearms, you can still have massacres, you'd accept that?
answer: Especially if you're telling the potential victim you can't be armed.

question: Why do you know more about the impact and capability of the assault weapon than General McChrystal?
answer: While the general was busy defending the country much of the time outside of the country, understandably he may not have noticed the Korean merchants who used an -- not one, but many AR-15 rifles with large magazines to defend themselves --

question: When was that, Mr. Pratt?
answer: -- against the mobs -- during the Los Angeles riots.

question: When was that?
answer: That was some, what, 20 years ago.

question: Did you know how long ago that was, Mr. Pratt?
answer: We're able -- let me finish my point if you would.

question: Why do you feel so strongly that civilians, despite what we just heard from a leading general, should still be able to have access to these killing machines?
answer: Well, because the general and his troops are not going to be there to protect the average American, the military nor the police after social order implodes, after a hurricane, after an earthquake, during riots.

question: Why do you still persist in trying to persuade Americans that the complete opposite is true?

question: That's what you're saying?

question: Mr. Pratt, you are stating -- you are telling me on CNN we had how many gun murders last year?
answer: Nine hundred seventy, and you have a violent crime rate that is the fourth highest in any country in the world.

question: What did you make of Mr. Jones' performance on the interview?
answer: Well, it seemed that you had improved your demeanor quite a bit from my own experience with you, and I congratulate you for maintaining it during that whole interview.

question: Do you believe that?
answer: That's what our founders believed.

question: How many guns do you want in America, Mr. Pratt?
answer: That's not for me to decide.

question: Do you think every American should have an AR-15?
answer: Every American should be able to get an AR-15.

question: What are you going to do if President Obama wins his battle and brings in new stricter gun control legislation?
answer: Well, he's not going to do it by legislative, in my opinion.

question: You're likening President Obama to George III?
answer: Well, he -- President Obama hasn't banned the importation of ball and powder yet, which George III did, but that was one of the major contributory elements to our war for independence.

question: Where's the humanity in doing nothing after these massacres?
answer: The humanity was being able to do nothing during the massacre.

question: And you'd be happy with that if every school suddenly had people running around with guns, right?
answer: You're a good guesser, yes, sir.

question: Where are they going to put them?
answer: Well, when people carry a concealed firearm, one doesn't exactly know for sure, and the element of surprise remains with the person carrying concealed, which means that somebody contemplating doing something horrible doesn't know which person or persons might be able to arrest him, to stop him, and that's why our jurisdictions that have easy access to concealed carry firearms enjoy lower murder rates than, say, the gun control Mecca of Chicago, which does better than one murder a day.

question: So I'm going to give you one more chance before we finish to say again how many gun murders you believed were in England and Wales in 2011?
answer: More important than the number of murders and it doesn't matter how a murder is committed, so I'm not going to really care about --

question: Can you repeat the number of gun murders that you said earlier?
answer: The data we have seen was 970.
